alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:59PM CDT until March 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Henderson County in west central Illinois... Northern Warren County in west central Illinois... Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Mercer County in northwestern Illinois... Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Scott County in east central Iowa... Northeastern Muscatine County in east central Iowa... Southern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 559 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Donahue to near Little York, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... DeWitt, Long Grove, Clinton County Fairgrounds, Scott County Park and Park View around 605 PM CDT. McCausland and Malone around 610 PM CDT. Camanche, Low Moor, North Henderson, Clinton Municipal Airport, Rock Creek Marina and Campground, Folletts and Rock Creek Park around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Albany, Woodhull, New Windsor, Alpha, East Clinton, New Windsor, Clinton, Fulton, Nekoma, Ustick, Bishop Hill, Ulah, Galva, Kewanee Municipal Airport, Franklin Corners, German Corner, White Pigeon, Kewanee, Coleta and Johnson-Sauk Trail State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central, northwestern and west central Illinois...and east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central, northwestern and west central Illinois...and east central Iowa.
